revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Cisco |model=RV315 |revision=W |asin= |manuf_country=China |manuf=CyberTAN |manuf_model=CVR328W |manuf_rev= |availability=now |fcc_date=04/08/2013 |fcc_id=N89-RV315W |pcb_id=3763-12000102R |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=CyberTAN WM9283N |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9283 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand=Marvell |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6095F |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=8 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=2 |flags=3G capable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=cisco |default_pass=cisco |oui=5C:50:15 |oui_eth=5C:50:15 }} {{TagLine|Cisco Broadband Wireless VPN Router}}
Per FCC docs (and a [https://supportforums.cisco.com/docs/DOC-31335 deleted '''Cisco''' support page]), the RV315W supports :3G connectivity, presumably via a USB port on the device.
"3763-12000102R" and the ''[[Cisco]]'' logo is silkscreened on the main board. :"3763-14100103R" is silkscreened on the back of the wireless module. :The FCC EUT is labeled as a CVR328W (''Cisco Wireless-N 3G VPN Router'').
Default settings are per the FCC manual and label. :{{WiFiCert|WFA19026|04/09/2013}} A label affixed to the FCC EUT seems to indicate... *Some devices may use a 5C:50:15 ('''Cisco''') OUI (OEM: [[CyberTAN]]) *The default SSID pattern may be '''cisco-XXXX''' (upper case hex digits, :appears to be last 4 of the MAC on the label)
:;PSU The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''DVE''' DSA-50W-12 1 120360 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 1.2A -> 12VDC, 3A).
